documents.document: @dpfdpf that was quick David! Still a couple more years to go!

Vile @DomPost cartoon of @JudithCollinsMP today goes too far. What happens when women put themselves forward.
@CTrevettNZH you poor buggers - I've worked in the attic; you don't know if its raining or shining.....
Amazing job getting quake front page out today @DomPost - congrats
@rebeccamacfie that was the first quake I've felt scared. Poor Cheviot.
You ok in chch? That was a huge shake in wgtn https://t.co/2xj8se1pTM
So which one is the real Donald trump ? https://t.co/E5uwbjTNQZ

@toby_etc would be a very slow moving film.....
So if Britain leaves the EU, can we rewind to 1973 and have our butter access back?
Why is leaving a mother's body for her child to find not considered an aggravating factor when considering sentencing?
Great piece on skewed sentences for wife killers @catmaclennanNZ @nzherald https://t.co/l05X21z2EJ
@phirate yes - out of stock since late january
Main anti-migraine medicine available on prescription in NZ out of stock since late January. Rizamelt. No substitutes. No explanation. #ouch

Brilliant new exhibition @wgtnmuseum The Attic - extraordinary cabinets filled with treasure and stories - will be back for another look
@Donna_Chisholm now you're talking!
@Donna_Chisholm picture will always be complex cos cancer primarily a wild card disease - two thirds cases due to random genetic mutations
@Donna_Chisholm Love that copy paper. Mine was a photo story about a great dane falling through a ceiling. Doggerel.
Cool. Fletcher Building attempting to eliminate bias in hiring with "blind" recruitment of graduates. http://t.co/m7VCB6nB5C
@AndrewPaulWood @rumpole3 can the wind blow the other way on a flag that is still hypothetical?

Interesting. Labour putting pressure on PI Nat MP Pesata Sam Lotu-Liga to conscience vote against Sky City deal. http://t.co/qcz3RdjoUL
@alisonmccull @LenRichards I think Alison would definitely be the sort of person who would vote as she is told. wouldn't you alison?
@alisonmccull but presumably you wouldn't get a vote, only the delegates?
@roddrury seriously how do you do that!
@Garner_Live @avancenz RT "are you sending him emails on holiday" Bloody hell, duncan, that's a bit rough!!
On Robertson: don't think a Wellingtonian can hold the leadership. @BillyRalston #labour
@dpfdpf @robhosking i stand corrected! hmm maybe Mike Moore on losing leadership was "I slept like a baby. I woke up, I cried, I wet myself"
@_jjw_ @BenUffindell I think given Labour's track record for unity and harmony, that would definitely work.
@robhosking @dpfdpf Shearer probably feeling as Mike Moore did after he lost leadership: "like a Bosnian whose goat has been raped".
@robhosking @dpfdpf what about geoffrey palmer
Beehive press secs: Time for a dump day
@althecat @toby_etc @dpfdpf not much of a self-immolation that makes your opponent catch fire
@akominik maybe you're right. the fish rolled him.
@dpfdpf @johnkeypm Clark got through Bolger, English, Shipley and Brash before Key got her... So maybe 5 is the magic number?
@cespiner They'll have the time of their life - all jostling for attention...
@akominik @Garner_Live except shearer ran the coup himself
@EricCrampton @lyndonhood "Youth crime rates in NZ at an all-time low". Time for national soul-searching. Where have we gone wrong?
On NZ's "Woody Allen" economy. http://t.co/Wf98nUtzaG

@Zagzigger the Linda Clark business. good on her for helping out.
@Zagzigger Oh John. You are being silly.
@simondangerday I see your point. My hands got inky once. Here in Wgtn of course journos not just staying at their desk, but under desks.
@simondangerday but i think Dompost might give a fellow Fairfax journo a free copy!!
Snappers: Parl Commissioner for Environment seeking amateur photographers' photos for their website. http://t.co/w3V7qIS4v8
NZers told: "Dairy the backbone of our economy. Negative impacts on rivers, lakes, and soils inevitable, so don't question them." Mike Joy
"We are world-leading consumers of non-renewable fertiliser to be world-leading producers of low-value milk powder" Mike Joy, Dom Post
"We also import more palm kernel than any other country." Mike Joy, DomPost
Mike Joy does it again, oped DomPo: NZ dairy is unregulated industrialisation, using highest per capita nitrogen and phosphates in world
This town is too hot.
@bernardchickey give the man a job as a seismologist!
Uh oh. Rules for marine farming being reviewed. Maybe they'll be tightened up to protect the enviroment?
Or is child protection policy bid by Nats to neutralise Labour on the whole "Nats don't care about kids" . Distracts from child poverty.
@JudithCollinsMP @malosilima @felixmarwick @paulabennettmp Interesting. Having women in cabinet does bring different results...
@TwoPaddocks It's a compliment. They clearly believe you look ridiculously young at present.
